benchmark_details.name: FELM (Factual Evaluation of large Language Models)
benchmark_details.overview: FELM is a benchmark for evaluating the factuality of text generated by large language models (LLMs) across diverse domains. It involves collecting LLM-generated responses and annotating them with fine-grained factuality labels.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a benchmark that aids in the assessment and improvement of factuality evaluators for large language models.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset is collected solely from ChatGPT, which might affect the generalizability of the findings.

data.format: Annotated text segments with factual labels
data.annotation: Annotated with factuality labels, error types, and reference links.

methods: Segmentation of responses into text spans
Human annotation of factuality and error types
methodology.calculation: F1 score is calculated based on the detection of factual errors at both segment-level and response-level.
methodology.interpretation: The F1 score and balanced accuracy provide insights into the effectiveness of factuality evaluators.
methodology.baseline_results: Current LLMs show unsatisfactory performance in detecting factual errors.
methodology.validation: Annotation reviewed by experts and high agreement rates reported.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All annotated responses are treated to ensure privacy and anonymity.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Data is collected from publicly available LLM outputs.
